Resources

This section is dedicated to offering helpful resources for new and returning clients and their families and loved ones, and for healthcare professionals. Here, new clients can download the necessary forms for their DBT assessment and existing clients can download diary cards. There are also links to additional resources for crises, research and better understanding how DBT can work for you and your loved ones.

DBT of TOWSON
Dialectical Behavior Therapy

Support Hotlines

National Suicide Prevention Lifeline:1-800-273-8255

Maryland Crisis Hotline: 1-800-422-0009

Baltimore Crisis Response:410-752-2272

Crisis Text Line:text HOME to 741741

Research: Behavioral Tech, LLC, founded by Marsha Linehan, is the original DBT training program. They are the leaders in providing DBT training for providers as well as research in documenting the effectiveness of DBT across various populations

Behavioral Tech Research

Books

Overcoming Borderline Personality Disorder
The Buddha and the Borderline
Dr. Linehan’s books can be found on her website, Behavioral Tech

For Healthcare Professionals​

We offer a few different options for your client/patient:

1. Your client attends DBT Skills Group Only:

You stay on as the primary therapist and your client attends our DBT Skillful Living Group. We will collaborate with you to target the needs of your client.

Referral Form
Primary Therapist Statement

2. Your client attends DBT Skills Group and receives individual skills coaching, while you stay on as the primary therapist.

Skills coaching sessions are utilized to support skill acquisition and generalization. Sometimes clients need a little extra support.

3. Your client is in need of both Skillful Living Group and Individual DBT therapy.

We currently have waitlist for this service. Please contact us. We have developed close relationships with some great DBT providers in the area and would be happy to provide you with a list of potential referrals!

Application for individual therapy

How Can I Support My Client in DBT Group?

You can support your DBT client by purchasing DBT Skills Training Manual and Worksheets, by Marsha Linehan and reviewing skills in weekly therapy sessions. Your client will be learning skills from this book and be assigned homework each week to reinforce skill acquisition and generalization. Reviewing group material and The Diary Card in individual therapy will help to reinforce skills.
